did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Upchurch was a Duke University Trustee as well as the founder of the Chapel Choir.
Collection includes photographs, correspondence, and subject files.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 24-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.
Collection is open for research except for one file which is restricted for 50 years (noted in the container list).

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter McGowan Upchurch Papers, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Walter McGowan Upchurch Papers were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1989.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Walter McGowan Upchurch, Jr. was a trustee of Duke University and the founder of Duke's Chapel Choir. He was also an executive of Shell Oil. Upchurch graduated from Duke University with an A.B. in 1931 and a law degree in 1936. In 1933, he founded the Duke Chapel Choir and became its first director. He became director of Placement Services in 1940, which helped provide educational and placement help for students and alumni. Upchurch served as a Duke trustee from 1964-1977, when he was named trustee emeritus. He received the University Medal for Distinguished Meritorious Service in December 1988 and passed away in January 1989.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes materials related to the Duke Chapel Choir, reunions, Shell Oil, correspondence, and photographs. Please be aware of the restricted Board of Trustees file, which is restricted for 50 years.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Walter McGowan Upchurch Papers held in "general collections" of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book and Manuscript Library.
